sentences.english: She really was the life and soul of that party.
sentences.chinese: 她可真是那场派对的台柱啊。

sentences.english: She has been the principal dancer in our ballet for ten years.
sentences.chinese: 十年来她一直是我们芭蕾舞团的台柱演员。

sentences.english: You're the mainstay of the company.
The white hope of the England side had been given out.
sentences.chinese: 英格兰的台柱已被判出局。

sentences.english: He was a pillar of the Blacktable Conservative Association, a magistrate, and a church warden.
sentences.chinese: 他是布莱克斯达布尔保守党的台柱，治安理事，以及。

sentences.english: Many see their paper as a pillar of democracy in the "midst of society", according to Kai Diekmann, its editor.
sentences.chinese: 许多人把报纸看成社会当中民主的台柱子。

sentences.english: He thinks he's a mainstay of the company, but he's really rather small beer.
sentences.chinese: 自以为是公司的台柱，但事实上他是个微不足道的人。

sentences.english: The pillars of the Huntsman stand were made using an infusion process.
sentences.chinese: 亨斯曼展台的台柱是通过灌注工艺制成的。

definition: role of vivacious young female in Chinese opera
tablet announcing the name of leading actor in a theatrical production/by extension, the lead role
currently popular (of movie stars, singers etc)
erhua variant of 名角[ming2 jue2]
to manage the household/to be the one in charge of the family/to call the shots/to be in charge
the four heavenly kings (Sanskrit vajra)/the four guardians or warrior attendants of Buddha
